paragraphs.text: This was an excellent summary, Qina; thank you. I’ve been on Mastodon since mid-week last week, like it a lot, but you’ve cleared up a few things for me. One question: What’s a CW?

ebedbe01d510.title: This was an excellent summary, Qina; thank you.

paragraphs.name: 86d9
paragraphs.text: But those are some of the more obvious differences. Mastodon is built as a “Twitter user’s utopia”: one where advertising, racism and hate speech is strictly prohibited and equality is key.

paragraphs.name: eccc
paragraphs.text: The point of all this isn’t to collect likes or follows, but perhaps so people might actually have conversations. Unlike Twitter, Mastodon doesn’t suggest people you should follow. You find them by seeing what they’re tooting.

paragraphs.name: aaa4
paragraphs.text: Since cross-posting from Mastodon to Twitter doesn’t work and posting about Mastodon on Twitter might be frowned upon, what do Mastodon users talk about on Mastodon?
